title: (x) Ornate stressed display sans - Borealis (custom font) {Angel}
content:
Does anybody know what font this is? or is it customized?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 7.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%207_2.jpg) | 68.23 KB |

 [‹ (x) Lancôme logo - custom designed {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/typophile.com/node/42733 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Good magazine logo compact sans - custom (similar to Alternate Gothic) {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/typophile.com/node/42708 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bohemas

comments.content: Reminds me of [SuperVeloz](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/andreubalius.com/typerepublic/supervelozB.html) which is a kit of parts that could be combined to make something similar.
What is the source of this sample?

It’s called Borealis and is a custom design by Grandpeople...

A FONT NAMED BOREALIS  
“What’s the font in the festival magazine and on your posters called? I’ve never seen it before”. The question we’ve had to answer several times the last weeks and the answer is rather simple: The font is called “Borealis” and is designed for the festival by the eminent designers in the local design collective Grandpeople. More about Grandpeople at [http://www.grandpeople.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/www.grandpeople.org/ "http://www.grandpeople.org/").

[http://www.typophile.com/node/37782](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37782 "http://www.typophile.com/node/37782")

Actually, I think it’s not by Grandpeople. I just read an interview with [Martin Kvamme](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/www.unitdeltaplus.com/) on this poster. He did the poster with Mike Patton and Stian Carstensen.

Forgive me, I was wrong. Magnus Voll Mattiassen of Grandpeople did the typeface and poster in your image, as well as this years poster.

[Here’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20080304034638/http:/www.studvest.no/kultur.php?art_id=8209) the article I was referring to. I misunderstood. Martin Kvamme did a poster for Mike Patton (who is playing at Borealis).
Such a cool typeface, well done to the good guys at gp.
